F.1.1.name: Investment in agricultural holdings
F.1.1.objective: Modernize, improve performance, production, sustainability, innovation.
F.1.1.beneficiaries: Farmers, Producer Organizations, farmer groups in Madeira
criteria: Compliance with legal requirements and EU standards
F.1.1.support: Small: up to 70-80%; Medium: up to 60-80%; Large: up to 50-80%; possible bonuses

F.1.2.name: Installation of young farmers
F.1.2.objective: Support young people to start an agricultural holding.
criteria: Same scales and requirements as F.1.1
F.1.2.support: Similar to F.1.1; with bonuses for organic/strategic projects

F.1.3.name: Processing and marketing of agricultural products
F.1.3.objective: Introduce/modernize technologies, improve packaging, storage, and quality.
F.1.3.beneficiaries: Farmers, companies (SME or not), Madeira’s public sector
criteria: Business plan, technical and financial viability
F.1.3.support: Up to 80%, depending on SME/non-SME, rural/non-rural, young farmer

F.1.4.name: Investment in collective irrigation
F.1.4.objective: Sustainable irrigation infrastructures, water transport and storage.
F.1.4.beneficiaries: Water management entities, Madeira public sector, farmer associations
criteria: Compliance with technical and legal requirements

F.1.5.name: Access to agricultural holdings
F.1.5.objective: Paths, tracks, access to improve competitiveness.
F.1.5.beneficiaries: Public administration, municipalities, associations, Madeira public sector
criteria: Licensing and environmental impact if applicable

F.1.7.name: Non-productive investments
F.1.7.objective: Support walls, protection against wildlife, preservation of landscape/biodiversity.
F.1.7.beneficiaries: Farmers, Producer Organizations, groups, Madeira public sector

F.4.1.name: Young farmer installation premium
F.4.1.objective: Provide financial support to young farmers setting up for the first time.
F.4.1.beneficiaries: Young farmers 18-40 years old, individuals or legal entities
criteria: Commitment to be an Active Farmer for 5 years
F.4.1.support: Non-repayable premium; amount depends on farm size and farmer status

F.5.1.name: Crop, animal, and plant insurance premium
F.5.1.objective: Reduce climate risks, diseases, and pests through insurance.
F.5.1.beneficiaries: Madeira farmers with eligible insurance policies
criteria: Compliance with deadlines and application submission
F.5.1.support: Co-financing of insurance premium (percentage legally defined)
